page.title: 16Employment In Ogmore Vale
page.content: Ogmore Vale and Wyndham are communities which grew up around the coal industry. The last working colliery in the valley, the Wyndham Western, closed a couple of years ago. The last link with coal mining is the washeries in Ogmore Vale which employs about 140 men and to which coal is brought from the Garw Valley. Its future is not garenteed. The Penllwyngwent Industrial Estate is an attempt at attracting much needed light industry in the area and at present afford employment. In a class of 30 Pupils, 8 said that their fathers worked in a coal mine or washery, 15 said that their mothers worked. When asked what would the pupils like to do when they left school none mentioned working in the coal industry.
